basics.name: Yalda Eftekhari
basics.label: Machine Learning Computer Vision Intern
basics.summary: Master student in Computer Science at Sorbonne University, specializing in image processing, computer vision, and deep learning. Experienced in developing end-to-end ML and vision pipelines using PyTorch, TensorFlow, and OpenCV. Passionate about applying AI to real-world problems, innovation, and scalable software solutions. Seeking a 6-month internship (Mar–Aug 2025) to contribute to applied machine learning and computer vision projects in research or industry.

work.summary: Engineered and benchmarked deep learning pipelines for glomeruli segmentation in renal pathology using U-Net, Mask R-CNN, and multi-task models (Cerberus). Enabled reproducible and high-throughput biopsy analysis for improved kidney disease assessment.
highlights: Engineered and benchmarked deep learning pipelines for glomeruli segmentation in renal pathology
Used U-Net, Mask R-CNN, and multi-task models (Cerberus)
Enabled reproducible and high-throughput biopsy analysis for improved kidney disease assessment

work.summary: Implemented deep image restoration models (MIMO-UNet, HiNet) for deblurring tasks, achieving improved PSNR/SSIM metrics on benchmark datasets. Evaluated algorithmic performance and translated research methods into practical solutions.
highlights: Implemented deep image restoration models (MIMO-UNet, HiNet) for deblurring tasks
Achieved improved PSNR/SSIM metrics on benchmark datasets
Evaluated algorithmic performance and translated research methods into practical solutions

work.summary: Collaborated in an agile 10-member team maintaining backend infrastructure for a Robo-Adviser platform serving over 5,000 users. Developed and monitored RESTful APIs using FastAPI and PostgreSQL, enhancing reliability and reducing API latency by 15%.
highlights: Collaborated in an agile 10-member team maintaining backend infrastructure
Developed and monitored RESTful APIs using FastAPI and PostgreSQL
Enhanced reliability and reduced API latency by 15%

education.area: Master of Science in Computer Science (Image Processing)
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science

presentations.name: Talk Title
presentations.description: Brief description of the talk or presentation

portfolio.name: 3D Tree Detection from LiDAR Data
portfolio.description: Built a 3D tree detection and modeling workflow using Open3D, OpenAlea, and Blender; applied RANSAC and DBSCAN to LiDAR point clouds, achieving 90% point reduction while preserving geometry.

portfolio.name: Web Scraping and ML for Data Analysis
portfolio.description: Performed advanced data analysis on real-world datasets using scikit-learn, applying PCA, clustering, and time-series analysis to uncover key patterns and trends; implemented lightweight Python scrapers for data collection.

portfolio.name: Text Classification Benchmark Using BERT
portfolio.description: Fine-tuned BERT-based classifiers on an imbalanced text dataset and benchmarked against SVM, Logistic Regression, and LSTM models using metrics such as accuracy, F1, and recall.

portfolio.name: Applied Image Processing
portfolio.description: Developed image processing workflows using Python for enhancement, segmentation, and pattern recognition, integrating PCA and Eigenfaces for visual analysis.
